features.name: Simple Dynamic Job Tool
features.excerpt: The Simple Dynamic Job Tool feature enables you to define for non-linear assets how the tool hours and/or quantities will be calculated on the work order. 8.4.6.3 Additional Features Job Ownership - The Job Ownership feature enables you to specify on the job template the person or team responsible for planning the work, the job owner. Job Site Ownership - The Job Site Ownership feature enables you to specify on the job template the supervisor, lead and work group that will be responsible for performing the work planned. Job Process Control - The Job Process Control feature allows you to control on the job template when an activity will be allowed to start based on the completion of its predecessor activities. Job Scheduling Indicators - The Job Scheduling Indicators feature allows you to specify on the job template whether location or asset downtime is required, and whether in order to schedule the work a location or asset maintenance window will be required. These indicators tell you that you need to plan a suitable time with operations. Job Appointments - The Job Appointment feature allows you to indicate that when scheduling the work a fixed appointment date/time will be required. Job Constraints - The Job Constraints feature enables you to specify on the job template the time period around a target start that a work order should be scheduled within. Job Priority - The Job Priority feature enables you to specify on the job template the work priority relative to other jobs. Job Activity Scheduling - The Job Activity Scheduling features enables you to specify on the job template whether activities will be included in work scheduling, this can be defined for each activity. Job Interruption - The Job Interruption feature enables you to specify on the job template whether long running jobs or activities should continue from shift to shift or whether they can be interrupted so that only one shift performs the work. Job Repair Facilities - The Job Repair Facilities feature is used with transportation assets that can be maintained at different locations. It indicates on the job template whether the work will require a repair facility to be scheduled. Job Activity Measurement - The Job Activity Measurement feature enables you to specify on the job template activity what measurement or condition will need to be recorded. Job Labor with Skill Levels - The Job Labor with Skill Levels feature enables you to specify on the job template the required labor disciplines at the skill level. Job Labor with Vendor - The Job Labor with Vendor feature enables you to specify on the job template the required labor disciplines that will be provided by a vendor. Job Labor with Vendor Contracts - The Job Labor with Vendor Contracts feature enables you to specify on the job template the required labor disciplines that will be provided by a vendor under a labor contract. Simple Job Crew - The Simple Job Crew feature enables you to specify on a the job template the required crew types or crews and the pool of crew members that will be used to man the crews. Job Material Vendor Sourcing - The Job Material Vendor Sourcing feature enables you to specify in the job template that the material will be sourced externally instead of from a storeroom, and optionally to specify the vendor. Job Material with Condition Code - The Job Material with Condition Code feature enables you to specify in the job template the required level of condition of the material item. Job Tool Storeroom Sourcing - The Job Tool Storeroom Sourcing feature enables you to specify in the job template the storeroom where the tools will be sourced from and whether a reservation will be required. 8.4.6.4 Notes 8.4.6.5 Tool Maintenance and Statutory Inspections Some tools will require regular maintenance or inspections, some may be subject to statutory inspections. From time to time a tool may also require a repair. These work orders will need to be scheduled as for other assets. These are periods of unavailability which effects the scheduling of the tool to other jobs, or interrupts other work order's tool usage and must therefore be accounted for when charging for tool usage. The cost of the maintenance or inspection of the tool falls to the asset owner which may be the tool storeroom. The setting of the tool charge should take into account these costs. Some organisations create a usage meter so that they know how often the tool is being used, and when to schedule maintenance. the cost of maintenance or inspection generally falls to the storeroom 8.4.6.6 Simple Job Register Status REVIEW Version v1.0 Review @Andrew Jeffery 07 Sep 2021 Capability Jobs & Activities (see page 216) 8.4.6.6.1 Definition The feature enables you to manage pre coded jobs, containing a job code (code and naming convention), and description and to make them active so that they can be applied to a work order. The long text of the description can be used for the work instructions. 8.4.6.6.2 Description TODO 8.4.6.6.3 Dependencies The feature enables you to manage the lifecycle of a job template, from draft to active or inactive. features.excerpt: The Service Request Customer feature enables you to see the service request on a map and review the geo location fields. Secrets  Business Capabilities (WHAT) Work Management  2769.3.5.3 Additional Features Service Request Affected Person - The Service Request Affected Person feature enables you to record who requires the service or who is being affected by the issue independently of the person reporting the request. Service Request Description - The Service Request Description feature enables you to compose a standardized description using a predefined naming convention. Service Request Service Categorization - The Service Request Service Catagorization feature enables you to categorise the request so that it is used with key performance indicators (KPIs) and service level agreements (SLAs) that can drive improvement in service management. Service Request Simple Priority - The Service Request Simple Priority feature enables a responder to the request to manage an internal priority. Service Request Impact/Urgency - The Service Request Impact/Urgency feature enables a responder to the request to manage an internal priority based on a matrix determined by the impact and urgency. Service Request Vendor Allocated - The Service Request Vendor Allocated feature allocates the service request to a vendor. Service Request Simple Targets - The Service Request Simple Targets feature allows target dates to be entered manually rather than being calculated by applying a Service Level Agreement. Service Request Multiple Assets - The Service Request Multiple Assets feature allows a single Service Request to reference multiple assets or locations that the request or issue is applicable to. Service Request Time Tracking - The Service Request Time Tracking feature enables you to record the hours spent evaluating or responding to a service request. Service Request Global Issue - The Service Request Global Issue feature enables one Service Request to act on behalf of many other similar requests linked to it so that status is inherited from the Global Issue. Service Request Ownership by Shift - The Service Request Ownership by Shift feature enables you to distribute service requests between shifts and would be used by a 24 hour service desk or operations team. Service Request Ownership by Availability - The Service Request Ownership by Availability feature enables you to assign requests taking into account their actual availability. Service Request Inherited Status - The Service Request Inherited Status feature will allow the status of the service request to be inherited from the status of follow-up incident or work orders. Service Request Configuration Items - The Service Request Configuration Items feature is used to manage the update of anything under version control, for example, documents, software, etc., and is used in Configuration Management. Service Request Inherited Address - The Service Request Inherited Address feature derives the address where work is to be performed or where a defect or incident occurred from either the location or asset. Service Request Individual Address - The Service Request Individual Address enables you to define the address where work is to be performed or where a defect or incident occurred. Secrets  Business Capabilities (WHAT) Work Management  277 Service Request Geographical Address - The Service Request Geographical Address enables you to locate on a map where work is to be performed or where a defect or incident occurred, and also to review the geo location fields. Service Request Create Incident - The Service Request Create Incident feature is used where defects or incidents are managed separately from other types of request. Service Request Create Problem - The Service Request Create Problem feature is used to where there is a need for the analysis and resolution of more complex defects or incidents that are likely to lead to the creation of a solution or knowledge article, and a change campaign to help eliminate the issue. Service Request SLA Calendar - The Service Request SLA Calendar feature derives the calendar that the SLA will use to calculate target dates from the calendar of the related location or asset. For example, the commitment time for responding to a facilities issue in a shop will be dependent on the shop opening hours.
